page.title: 18Oran Hall
page.content: {Oran Hall}is situated to the south of Catterick Village on the southern edge of R.A.F.Catterick.It is close to the A1 and surrounded by trees. Oran Hall was the home of the Booth family during the 19th and early 20th centuries. The Booth family are said to have had interests in cattle farming in South America. There are many references to the Booth family on the walls of Saint Anne's Parish Church in Catterick Village. The church bells were donated by one of the family. At present Oran Hall is divided into flats for R.A.F.Officers.
